meanings.definition: A tire with a white rubber sidewall.
meanings.sent1: The classic car had stylish whitewall tires.
meanings.sent2: I prefer the look of whitewall tires on vintage vehicles.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tire go to the gym? To get a whitewall!
meanings.sent4: The whitewall tires gleamed like fresh snow on the road.
meanings.sent5: The whitewall tires added a touch of elegance to the car.

meanings.definition: To paint or cover with whitewash.
meanings.sent1: He decided to whitewall the fence for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: She carefully whitewalled the old shed in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: Why did the painter bring a ladder to the whitewalling job? To reach the top!
meanings.sent4: The artist whitewalled the canvas with bold strokes of paint.
meanings.sent5: The children enjoyed helping to whitewall the garden wall.

meanings.sent1: The room looked brighter with a fresh whitewall.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a beautiful painting on the whitewall.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ghost refuse to haunt the whitewall? It was too bright!
meanings.sent4: The whitewall provided a clean backdrop for the art exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight reflected off the whitewall, creating a serene atmosphere.
